head.title: Police Investigating Link in Park Robberies

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Police Investigating Link in Park Robberies

abstract.p: New York City police investigate whether armed robbery of three women in Central Park is related to two other robberies in park last month; in each case, robber approached people, showed black gun and robbed them of cash and jewelry; no one has been hurt; (S)

block.p: Police officials said yesterday that they were investigating whether the gunpoint robbery of three women in Central Park on Thursday was the work of the man who is thought to have committed two other robberies in the park last month.

Officials said the robber in each case approached young people, usually women, in a section of the park bordered by Belvedere Castle to the north and Bow Bridge to the south, and showed a black gun. No one has been hurt, the police said.

Officials said the robber in each case approached young people, usually women, in a section of the park bordered by Belvedere Castle to the north and Bow Bridge to the south, and showed a black gun. No one has been hurt, the police said.

In the latest robbery, three women, all 23, were near the Belvedere Castle about 6 p.m. when a man showed them a gun and robbed them of $179 and a gold chain. In a robbery on April 6, a man with a gun robbed two young women as they walked near Bow Bridge. On April 28, a man and a woman near the bridge were robbed of $150.
